latestVersion.citationRequirements:
NOTE: Please cite original reference when using this data!

Original Reference: Michael McCormick 2012. "Movements and markets in the first millennium: information, containers and shipwrecks," Trade and Markets in Byzantium, ed. Cecile Morrisson (Washington D.C.: Dumbarton Oaks-Harvard University Press), pp. 51-98.

fields.value: Summary Geodatabase of Shipwrecks AD 1-1500, Status 2008

dsDescriptionValue.value: This summary database provides basic geographic and archaeological information on 1064 shipwrecks documented by A.J. Parker 1992 and subsequent publications. The geodatabase includes, where available, concise information about main cargoes, ship or wreck distribution sizes, ship gear, and essential bibliography.  The user should refer to the original publications for full details. This file represents the state of the geodatabase in April 2008, when M. McCormick 2012 "Movements and markets in the first millennium: information, containers and shipwrecks" was sent to press; a small number of wrecks were added down to 2010.  Our team continues to work toward future updates of the geodatabase of shipwrecks.  Additional information, corrections, and data about new wrecks will be received gratefully at darmc@harvard.edu.

publicationCitation.value: DARMC Scholarly Data Series Citation:	McCormick, M. et al. 2013. "Summary Geodatabase of Shipwrecks AD 1-1500, Status 2008" DARMC Scholarly Data Series, Data Contribution Series # 2013-1. DARMC, Center for Geographic Analysis, Harvard University, Cambridge MA 02138.
